original_text:
Cygnus
Informazioni generali
Software: ELK Studios
Rulli: 6 x 4 righe
Linee di gioco: fino a 262.144 modi per vincere
Importo minimo della puntata: 0,10 €
Importo massimo della puntata: 100 €
Vincita massima: 5.000 volte la puntata
Return to Player (RTP): 96,1 %
Jackpot massimo: 500.000 €
Volatilità: alta
Caratteristiche principali
A una prima, distratta occhiata Cygnus, tra gli ultimi prodotti del provider ELK Studios, potrebbe apparire solo come un’altra slot machine che va ad arricchire il lunghissimo elenco di giochi a tema egiziano. Sebbene il tema faccia davvero riferimento all’Antico Egitto, Cygnus è diversa dalla gran parte delle slot che abbiamo provato fino a questo momento: il titolo del gioco si riferisce alla stella del Cigno, facente parte della Croce del Nord, una costellazione che pare allineata con precisione alle piramidi di Giza. Secondo quanto riportato nel foglio di gioco, questo allineamento determina una sorta di connessione cosmica tra il cielo e la terra, alimentando delle leggende secondo le quali furono proprio gli alieni provenienti dalla Croce del Nord a costruire le piramidi di Giza.
Galassie e Antico Egitto dunque, in un gioco che riserva tantissime sorprese davvero interessanti.
L’aspetto del gioco è quello classico delle slot a tema egiziano, con la griglia di gioco posta davanti all’ingresso di una maestosa piramide, incorniciata da delle palme e da una costellazione che brilla nel cielo notturno. Ciò che colpisce, sono i sei rulli posizionati tra due pilastri, che si sviluppano in altezza con le quattro righe di simboli. Il pilastro destro, ancor prima che inizino a girare i rulli, mostra dei moltiplicatori molto interessanti.
Modalità di gioco
Inizialmente, il gioco presenta 4.096 modi per vincere e per ottenere delle combinazioni che pagano, occorre allineare almeno tre simboli identici su rulli adiacenti a partire dal primo, quindi da sinistra verso destra.
La modalità di gioco non è lineare, ma funziona con un sistema chiamato “Avalanche” che accresce il numero delle righe con i simboli su ogni rullo, portandole a 8 e aumentando i modi per vincere fino ad arrivare all’incredibile numero di 262.144!
Il simbolo che ha il valore più alto in assoluto è il 7, che paga 30 volte la puntata quando compare su tutti i sei rulli, mentre altri simboli di Cygnus includono quattro tipologie di gemme (con valore basso), un ibis, un cammello e un gatto, che invece hanno dei pagamenti abbastanza alti.
Cygnus: RTP, volatilità e range di scommessa
Tra i dettagli di questa particolarissima slot abbiamo un range di scommesse che parte da soli 10 centesimi fino a un massimo di 100 € a giro. È disponibile anche la funzione Autoplay, grazie alla quale è possibile impostare fino a 100 giri automatici.
Secondo quanto riportato dalla ELK stessa, Cygnus ha una volatilità valutata 8/10, quindi molto alta, il che implica vincite poco frequenti ma possibilità di portare a casa delle somme di denaro interessanti.
L’RTP (return to player) è del 96,1%, associato a un tasso di successo del 23%: questo significa che nonostante la volatilità parecchio alta, Cygnus è un gioco in cui tutto sommato si vince con una discreta regolarità e che gli importi sono in genere abbastanza consistenti.

raw_translation.response:
Cygnus: A Slot Game for the Daring Ones

If you're looking for a high-volatility game that combines the wonders of the galaxy with the mysteries of ancient Egypt, then look no further than Cygnus. Developed by ELK Studios, this slot game boasts 6 reels and up to a whopping 262,144 ways to win. Starting at a minimum bet of €0.10, players can go all the way up to €100 for a chance to win the maximum jackpot of €500,000.

At first glance, Cygnus may seem like just another Egyptian-themed game, but it's so much more than that. Its name refers to the star in the Cygnus constellation, which is said to have a cosmic connection to the pyramids of Giza. According to legend, aliens from the Cygnus constellation may have even played a part in building these wonders of the world.

As for the game itself, players will be impressed by the classic Egyptian design, complete with a majestic pyramid and a starry night sky. The six reels are positioned between two pillars, with the right-hand pillar displaying some interesting multipliers.

The gameplay is not linear, but works on an "Avalanche" system that increases the number of rows of symbols on each reel, ultimately leading to an incredible 262,144 ways to win. The highest-value symbol is the 7, which pays out 30 times the bet when it appears on all six reels.

The range of bets in Cygnus starts at just 10 cents and can go up to €100, with the option to use the Autoplay function for up to 100 automatic spins. The game's high volatility means that wins may not come as often, but when they do, they can be quite substantial. 

With an RTP of 96.1% and a success rate of 23%, Cygnus is a game that can reward the daring ones with decent and consistent payouts. So, if you're ready to take on the mysteries of the stars and the secrets of the pyramids, give Cygnus a try.

raw_translation.response:
Attention, experienced players! Here's a review of the slot game "Cygnus" that you won't want to miss!

Cygnus
General Information
Software: ELK Studios
Reels: 6 x 4 rows
Paylines: up to 262,144 ways to win
Minimum bet amount: €0.10
Maximum bet amount: €100
Maximum payout: 5,000 times the bet
Return to Player (RTP): 96.1%
Maximum jackpot: €500,000
Volatility: High
Key Features
At first glance, Cygnus, one of the latest offerings from provider ELK Studios, may seem like just another slot machine to add to the already extensive list of Egyptian-themed games. However, despite the theme’s reference to Ancient Egypt, Cygnus is different from most of the slots we've tried up to this point: the game's title refers to the star of the Swan, part of the Northern Cross constellation, which appears to be aligned precisely with the pyramids of Giza. According to the game sheet, this alignment creates a sort of cosmic connection between the sky and the earth, fueling legends that aliens from the Northern Cross were the ones who built the pyramids of Giza.
Galaxies and Ancient Egypt, therefore, come together in a game that has many truly interesting surprises in store.
The game has the classic look of Egyptian-themed slots, with the game grid placed in front of the entrance of a majestic pyramid, framed by palm trees and a constellation that glitters in the night sky. What's striking are the six reels positioned between two pillars, which grow taller with four rows of symbols. Even before the reels start spinning, the right pillar displays some very interesting multipliers.
Gameplay
Initially, the game features 4,096 ways to win, and to get winning combinations, you must align at least three identical symbols on adjacent reels starting from the first reel on the left, and then progress rightward.
The gameplay is not linear, but it works with a system called "Avalanche" that increases the number of rows with symbols on each reel, bringing them up to 8 and increasing the ways to win up to an incredible 262,144!
The symbol with the absolute highest value is the number 7, which pays out 30 times the bet when it appears on all six reels. Other Cygnus symbols include four types of gems (with low values), an ibis, a camel, and a cat, which instead have fairly high payouts.
Cygnus: RTP, Volatility, and Betting Range
Among the details of this unique slot, we have a betting range that starts at just 10 cents and goes up to a maximum of €100 per spin. The Autoplay feature is also available, allowing you to set up to 100 automatic spins.
According to ELK itself, Cygnus has a volatility rating of 8/10, which is very high, meaning that wins are infrequent but the possibility of bringing home significant amounts of money is there.
The RTP (return to player) is 96.1%, associated with a 23% success rate: this means that despite the high volatility, Cygnus is a game where you win fairly regularly and the amounts are generally quite substantial.

Key Features
At first glance, Cygnus, one of the latest offerings from provider ELK Studios, may seem like just another slot machine to add to the already extensive list of Egyptian-themed games. However, despite the theme’s reference to Ancient Egypt, Cygnus is different from most of the slots we've tried up to this point: the game's title refers to the star of the Swan, part of the Northern Cross constellation, which appears to be aligned precisely with the pyramids of Giza. According to the game sheet, this alignment creates a sort of cosmic connection between the sky and the earth, fueling legends that aliens from the Northern Cross were the ones who built the pyramids of Giza.
Galaxies and Ancient Egypt, therefore, come together in a game that has many truly interesting surprises in store.
The game has the classic look of Egyptian-themed slots, with the game grid placed in front of the entrance of a majestic pyramid, framed by palm trees and a constellation that glitters in the night sky. What's striking are the six reels positioned between two pillars, which grow taller with four rows of symbols. Even before the reels start spinning, the right pillar displays some very interesting multipliers.
Gameplay
Initially, the game features 4,096 ways to win, and to get winning combinations, you must align at least three identical symbols on adjacent reels starting from the first reel on the left, and then progress rightward.
The gameplay is not linear, but it works with a system called "Avalanche" that increases the number of rows with symbols on each reel, bringing them up to 8 and increasing the ways to win up to an incredible 262,144!
The symbol with the absolute highest value is the number 7, which pays out 30 times the bet when it appears on all six reels. Other Cygnus symbols include four types of gems (with low values), an ibis, a camel, and a cat, which instead have fairly high payouts.
Cygnus: RTP, Volatility, and Betting Range
Among the details of this unique slot, we have a betting range that starts at just 10 cents and goes up to a maximum of €100 per spin. The Autoplay feature is also available, allowing you to set up to 100 automatic spins.
According to ELK itself, Cygnus has a volatility rating of 8/10, which is very high, meaning that wins are infrequent but the possibility of bringing home significant amounts of money is there.
The RTP (return to player) is 96.1%, associated with a 23% success rate: this means that despite the high volatility, Cygnus is a game where you win fairly regularly and the amounts are generally quite substantial.
